title.narrative: Action for the Development of Marshall Islands Renewable Energies

description.narrative: Action for the Development of Marshall Islands Renewable Energies (ADMIRE) medium size project PIMS 3094
Enhanced institutional capacity to coordinate finance design supply and maintain RE installations

B1 Review of the MRD and OEPPC legislations completed by Year 2
B2 Complete the Energy Balance by end of Year 2
B3 A reviewed National Energy Policy adopted by end of Year 2

comment.narrative: Legislations not reviewed No adopted national energy and climate change policies and plans
Reviewed and amended legislations Adopted national energy and climate change policies and plans by Year 2
B2 Development and establishment of a renewable energy data collection system at the Energy Planning Division for purposes of energy planning and policy making
Reviewed and amended legislations Adopted national energy and climate change policies and plans by Year 2
B2 Development and establishment of a renewable energy data collection system at the Energy Planning Division for purposes of energy planning and policy making

description.narrative: Improved understanding of RE potential and increased number RE installations on the ground which enhances productivity and income generation

A1 Solar and wind monitoring studies and training are started in 2 atolls by Year 2
A2 Study of the nationwide copra oil potential and technical viability for power generation initiated by Year 2
A3 Technical viability of solar wind and biomass RE applications confirmed by Year 4
A4 Installation of 1000 solar PV systems completed by Year 4
A5 Electrify maintenance andor monitoring of 20 schools and 15 health centers with REPV by Year 4
A6 RE technical standards for PV wind and biomass prepared and adopted by Year 3
A1 Solar and wind monitoring studies and training are started in 2 atolls by Year 2
A2 Study of the nationwide copra oil potential and technical viability for power generation initiated by Year 2
A3 Technical viability of solar wind and biomass RE applications confirmed by Year 4
A4 Installation of 1000 solar PV systems completed by Year 4
A5 Electrify maintenance andor monitoring of 20 schools and 15 health centers with REPV by Year 4
A6 RE technical standards for PV wind and biomass prepared and adopted by Year 3

comment.narrative: None No comprehensive study yet None 300 new installations only 2 schools and health centers electrified No national RE standards

10 studies Complete study by Year 4 4 studies completed by Year 3 1000 new installations by year 4 20 schools and 15 health centers electrified maintained andor monitored Adopted National Standards by year 5

A3 Implemented the solar water pumping demonstration activity in partnership with the Ministry of RDs Agriculture Department
Implemented the project with WUTMI for the construction and distribution of solar food dehydrators for the women of Arno Atoll
Provision of technical assistance for biogas pilot project development in Majuro
Provision of repair and maintenance services for SHS installations in Arno Atoll
Initiated work on the following a Application of RET to a school facility b Setting up a biodiesel production for power generation on Beran Island Ailinglaplap and c Biodiesel production for transportation on Majuro and Arno

10 studies Complete study by Year 4 4 studies completed by Year 3 1000 new installations by year 4 20 schools and 15 health centers electrified maintained andor monitored Adopted National Standards by year 5

A3 Implemented the solar water pumping demonstration activity in partnership with the Ministry of RDs Agriculture Department
Implemented the project with WUTMI for the construction and distribution of solar food dehydrators for the women of Arno Atoll

description.narrative: Outcome 3 Strengthened legal and regulatory instruments to support RE dissemination financing and marketing

C1 Existing Legislations and Policies including for the copra industry are reviewed by Year 3 and new amendments and enactments by Year 4
C2 Commercial energy pricing policies and practices reviewed by Year 3
C1 Existing Legislations and Policies including for the copra industry are reviewed by Year 3 and new amendments and enactments by Year 4
C2 Commercial energy pricing policies and practices reviewed by Year 3

comment.narrative: Absence of legal and regulatory instruments to support RE dissemination financing and marketing
Legal and regulatory instruments to support RE dissemination financing and marketing by Year 4
C3 Initiated work on biodiesel policy particularly on the use of copra for biodiesel
Legal and regulatory instruments to support RE dissemination financing and marketing by Year 4
C3 Initiated work on biodiesel policy particularly on the use of copra for biodiesel

description.narrative: Outcome 4 Improved accessibility of capital for RE businesses

D1 Confirmed list of bankable projects by Year 3
D2 At least one training workshop and technical assistance to financing institutions by year 5
D3 Technical assistance to atolls on business opportunities in copra trading and shipping by Year 3

comment.narrative:
Absence of capital funds for RE projects and the lack of known commercially viable RE investment and marketing opportunities
opportunities
Availability of capital funds for RE projects and the confirmation of known commercially viable RE investment and marketing

D3 Initiated work on biodiesel development pilot project in Majuro Atoll and Beran Island Ailinglaplap Atoll for power generation for a local resort as well as technical assistance for Tobolar on the use of copraVCO and other coconut industry waste products as renewable energy resource
Availability of capital funds for RE projects and the confirmation of known commercially viable RE investment and marketing

D3 Initiated work on biodiesel development pilot project in Majuro Atoll and Beran Island Ailinglaplap Atoll for power generation for a local resort as well as technical assistance for Tobolar on the use of copraVCO and other coconut industry waste products as renewable energy resource

description.narrative: Outcome 5 Improved awareness skills and knowledge

E1 RE in schools curriculum by Year 4
E2 RE public awareness programmes are operational through the local media by end of Year 1
E3 Two local university andor tertiary graduates on RE by end of Year 4
E4 More than 100 trainees per year participate in the RE training activities of the ADMIRE

comment.narrative: Lack of awareness skills and knowledge about RE Widespread awareness skills and knowledge about RE in the RMI
Widespread awareness skills and knowledge about RE in the RMI including total of 500 trainees participate in RE training activities by year 5

E1 Completed the distribution of 206 solarelectric powered fans to primary classes K6 in both public and private schools on Majuro includes Ejit Island which is under Bikini Atoll Government jurisdiction and Kwajalein includes Lib Island This activity involved 25 schools impacting over 3000 young students on Majuro and Kwajalein Presentations on renewable energy resources were conducted at each school prior to the turnover of fans
E4 In depth private sector training on Solar PV systems completed in cooperation with IslandEco
Widespread awareness skills and knowledge about RE in the RMI including total of 500 trainees participate in RE training activities by year 5

E1 Completed the distribution of 206 solarelectric powered fans to primary classes K6 in both public and private schools on Majuro includes Ejit Island which is under Bikini Atoll Government jurisdiction and Kwajalein includes Lib Island This activity involved 25 schools impacting over 3000 young students on Majuro and Kwajalein Presentations on renewable energy resources were conducted at each school prior to the turnover of fans
E4 In depth private sector training on Solar PV systems completed in cooperation with IslandEco

description.narrative: Promotion of the productive use of Renewable Energy to reduce GHG emissions by removing the major barriers to the widespread and costeffective use of feasible RETs

comment.narrative: 85 GHG emissions reduced
55 ktons by year 5
55 ktons by year 5
